thread.title: ‘Amazed’ Van Gaal slams Manchester United F.C.’s lack of aggression against Arsenal F.C.
thread.title_full: ‘Amazed’ Van Gaal slams Manchester United F.C.’s lack of aggression against Arsenal F.C. | The Financial Express

author: financialexpress.com
title: ‘Amazed’ Van Gaal slams Manchester United F.C.’s lack of aggression against Arsenal F.C.
text:
Other Articles Atletico de Kolkata beat FC Goa 1-0 in ISL Sania Mirza-Martina Hingis cruise into China Open quarters India thrash New Zealand 3-1 to level Hockey Test series Manchester United F.C. manager Louis Van Gaal has admitted that he was ‘amazed’ by his side’s lack of aggression against Arsenal F.C. during their Premier League clash at the Emirates Stadium.
United suffered a shocking 0-3 defeat against Arsenal that moved them down to the third spot in the EPL table.
The Dutchman said he was surprised by his players’ attitude, saying there was no will to win the match despite being at the top of the league, the Mirror reports.
Further expressing his views on United’s defeat, the 64-year-old admitted that Arsenal were much more aggressive at that moment and there was a lack of ball-winning from his side.
United will now play against Everton in their Premier League clash on October 17 at Goodison Park.
First Published on October 05, 2015 4:30 pm
